data.title: Images looks blurry if window is resized and content stretched
data.body: As you might see on [my video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmnNl6cANus&index=3&list=PLFwt4X12huucOM_vr1_POILwIlr4eCFeF) the Ness sprite and the map looks blurry if you resize the window. It should ideally conserve the 8bit aspect, though.

data.title: Setting a new Texture for a Sprite node does not update preview
data.body:
I have set a Texture (image) for a Sprite node. In the editor's inspector a preview of this image is shown. Then I selected the Texture's context menu and selected "Clear", then I selected a new Texture (image). 

However, the preview in the inspector does still show the former image. After closing and restarting the Godot edtor the preview of the Sprite is correctly showing the right Texture.

data.title: Cannot debug script when external code editor set
data.body:
I have set an external code editor in Godot, that works fine. However now when I click on "Script" in the Godot editor then the script is always loaded in the external editor, but not in the built-in code editor as well.

Presumably this is expected behaviour. But if so, how can I then set a breakpoint in the script and debug it?

data.title: Hitboxes for fighting games
data.body: Whoo, I have had so much trouble with this, but I finally found a workaround. I am making a fighting game and I need some way to detect when attacks collide and where, and Godot currently doesn't offer anything that works quite like this. There are a lot of very close things, but nothing that's quite there yet, I managed to develop a work around though. You take an Area2D Node and when a body enters it (using the on_body_enter() signal) you set a variable to true and when it exits you set it to false. When the player attacks, you check if the variable is true and then apply the attack. Couldn't the Area2D node just have is_colliding() functionality attached to it? I know kinematic bodies do, but they also can't be passive, they push whatever is in front of them, unless I'm mistaken somehow.

data.title: scaling multiple nodes at once doesn't work
data.body:
If you select several nodes at once and then modify the scale property, the change does not apply to all selected nodes, only one of them.

(This was initially reported in the forum by another user, and I can confirm it. http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=269 )

data.title: Replacing nodes sometimes results in a crash
data.body:
In the rubegoldberg demo, if I do the following I can reliably produce a crash:

If I replace the top level Node with a Node2D, then replace that Node2D with a Node, and then replace that Node with another Node2D, it crashes.

data.title: Scaling RigidBody2D node does not scale child node's sprite
data.body: If I scale a RigidBody2D node that has a child Sprite node, the Sprite looks like it is scaled appropriately in the Godot editor. However, when I run the scene, the RigidBody2D does not appear to be scaled at all. An example of this can be seen if you scale one of the balls in the rubegoldberg demo.

data.title: rename node -> change in scripts?
data.body:
If I add a button and call it "Button" and write some GDScript that references it such as get_node("Button").connect, if I later on rename the button to "btnOptions", I also have to go into the code and change any references, to get_node("btnOptions").connect, for example.

Is there any plugin or option that automates this? It would save a lot of time in large projects where you rename some nodes after writing a lot of code.

data.title: add lua script support, fix unicode multi-char ime-input
data.body:
i'm added lua script support for godot engine and add a demo "autoload" from gdscript version of autoload
only tested under windows platform, and i think can works under other platform like android, mac, ect...

and fix unicode multi-char ime-input
and msvc project(i'm now woking with it)

data.title: Impossible to delete keyframes in AnimationPlayer
data.body: It's not possible to delete keyframes in the AnimationPlayer. I tried dragging a keyframe off of the timeline, but that resulted in it simply being at a negative time. You can delete entire tracks, but not individual keyframes.

data.title: Engine build improvements
data.body: Several improvements for the engine build system: makefile to give support for more tools and building time improved by 6 min to 1 min.

data.title: Fixed HTTPClient's possible 411 errors
data.body:
HTTPClient is receiving HTTP 411 error message from servers as response when tried to send POST request because of unspecified Content-Length header.

And I fixed this issue by adding new Content-Length header to the request string with body length.

data.title: CollisionShape2D helpers work for position changes, but not for size changes
data.body:
Suppose I create a CollisionShape2D under a RigidBody2D, and set its shape property (for example, RectangleShape2D).
Now, if I move this shape in the editor, the collisions in the running game will work as expected, but... If I "scale" the shape in the editor, this change will not influence the collisions in the running game, so you can reposition the shape, but you cannot resize it...  :-(

I noticed you can resize the shape "at hand" in the code, using the set_shape_transform(...) method of the CollisonObject2D class, with a scaled Matrix32 transform, so I think it should not be so difficult to make the editor apply this scale transform in a "visual" way (i.e.: you scale the shape in the gui, and godot set the right matrix transform)...

P.S.: the scaling works as expected using the CollisionPolygon2D helper.

data.title: Need option to lock a specific window size
data.body: In Godot project settings you can set a certain window size (width and height) for your application. However, the user can resize the window at runtime. For some games I need a certain screen size locked, ie. not resizable by the user. Please add such a feature.

data.title: Touchscreen button doesn't obey control positioning
Solved bug to select external editor url
data.body:
Solved bug to select external editor url.
Issue https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/145

data.title: Closes bb-code tags, allowing make_doc.sh to finish
Fix if statement with empty body.
data.body:
I get the following warning message :scream: :  

```
modules/multiscript/register_types.cpp:30:26: warning: if statement has empty body [-Wempty-body]
```

in line 30 of `modules/multiscript/register_types.cpp`:

``` 1
if (script_multi_script); // WARNING
        memdelete(script_multi_script);
```

data.title: Cannot Copy From Editor
data.body:
If I select a block of text and hit ctrl+c or use the dropdown menu from edit, nothing is copied to the clipboard. Pasting into the editor works fine with ctrl+v.

Right-clicking on text doesn't show a menu to copy either so the only methods I have to copy are ctrl+c or using the edit dropdown menu and hitting copy.

data.title: Key for Go to origin in 3D viewport
Selecting & copying error label
data.body:
In http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=254 I reported an issue and wanted to include the error message which I got, however I could not copy-paste the message "Attempt to call function 'play' in base 'null instance' on a null instance."

Screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/ogbkMUt.png
1. Turn the error message label into a read-only text field but allow selecting and copying text. By the way, the Debug output text field should allow selecting text also.

As for the error message, it is debatable whether clicking it should select all of its content for easier selection. At the very least, double- or at least triple-clicking should select all of it. (Does anybody happen to know the behavior of Unity/VisualStudio/Eclipse?)
1. Add an icon to either right or left of the right of the error message label, which has the function of copying the error message text to clipboard.
2. Display error messages in the command line output, when Godot is launched from such (This is probably unusable for many developers).

Without the ability to copy-paste these messages, collaborative (community) debugging takes more time.

data.title: rand
data.body: rand() doesnt work, unknow command

data.title: Color::contrasted() is broken
Font saving: engine should add the expected file ending if not provided
data.body:
I just received a message "couldn't save font" in the font import dialog, which I was able to fix by adding .fnt at the end of the file.

When only one file ending is possible, I expect a file save dialog to add the ending if it is missing.

I would like to request that either a file name ending is added automatically (needs to be clarified: what happens in .FNT/.FnT file ending cases?) or that the error message explains the reason for the failure ("You have to add the file name ending").

data.title: Animation overwrite
data.body: I have experienced this two times now. Godot has overwritten an animation with another. I don't know when this exactly happened. But suddenly an animation had the information of another in it.

data.title: Provide IRC link on contact web page
data.body:
Hello,

New users who like chat can be eased IRC access by providing a link to http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=godotengine on http://www.godotengine.org/wp/?page_id=56 (unless of course the intention is to keep out "noobs" :) )

data.title: Saving shortcut ALT+S, CTRL+S
data.body:
Hello,

I am a Linux user. Sometimes I use Windows 8.1. I nearly never use OS X. I have very little experience with Godot so far.

When writing scripts in Godot, I hit CTRL+S to save, which raises an "Alert! This operation can't be done without a tree root. - I see.." message.

Through the menu, I learned that ALT+S is the correct shortcut. This is uncommon. As far as I can tell, any Windows and Linux user would expect CTRL+S and any OS X user would expect CMD+S to be the shortcut.

It seems that other common shortcuts use CTRL (+F = search), so it seems like CTRL+S should be save, not ALT+S.

data.title: Setting stream with VideoPlayer node
data.body:
I tried to setup videoplayer to play big_buck_bunny.ogg video sample, but it's impossible to set stream neither from GUI nor from scripts.

From GUI Load set stream to null, new VideoStreamTheora does not allow to chose stream path (after several identical attempts it set it somehow but it does not work anyway).

From script set_strem() function require an object from Stream class which does not exists.

Format *.ogv works through Load (filter does not restrict to this format). New VideoStreamTheora and script - still do not work.

data.title: bug: Deleting a CollisionShape node in editor does not actually delete the node
data.body:
This happens both in 2D and 3D

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create 2 rigid bodies
2. Instantiate CollisionShapes on each rigid body
3. Set the shape of each CollisionShape (extend them beyond the sprite/mesh boundary to see better)
4. Set one rigid body's mode as static and the other as rigid
5. Position rigid body on top of the static body (to let the rigid body fall on top of the static)
6. Play scene
7. Observe the collision (expected)
8. Delete the collision shapes on both bodies
9. Play scene
10. Observe the collision (bug)
